heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 13 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.8°C) and outside temperature (down 6.0°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 5%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.9 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 447 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1052 m), feels like temperature (up 10.9°C), outside temperature (up 8.9°C), and dew point temperature (up 6.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 447.3m lower than yesterday, 688.5m lower than the past week, 1051.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 845m to a maximum of 3460m, averaging 1139.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1827.9m and 2190m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
